required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Expanded Treatment Protocol (ETP) of Ruxolitinib in Patients With Polycythemia Vera Who Were Hydroxyurea Resistant or Intolerant and for Whom no Treatment Alternatives Was Available.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multi-center, Expanded Treatment Protocol (ETP) of Ruxolitinib in Patients With Polycythemia Vera Who Are Hydroxyurea Resistant or Intolerant and for Whom no Treatment Alternatives Are Available.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this open-label, single arm, multi-center Expanded Treatment Protocol (ETP) was to provide early access to ruxolitinib and evaluate safety information in patients with polycythemia vera (PV) who were hydroxyurea (HU) resistant or intolerant and who had no other standard treatment option, nor did they qualify for another clinical study for PV

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events - All Grades

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hematocrit Levels at All Visits
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hematocrit levels from Baseline to each visit were measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Spleen Length
secondary_outcome.description: Change in spleen length from Baseline to each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form Total Symptom Score (MPN-SAF TSS)
secondary_outcome.description: The MPN-SAF (Appendix 6) was a disease specific questionnaire comprised of 10 items that measures fatigue related to MPN disease and the severity of nine of the most prevalent associated symptoms including: early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain, fever and weight loss. There were three recall periods used in this questionnaire, which were 24 hours for fatigue, the past week for symptoms of early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain and fever, and the past 6 months for weight loss, Each item was scored on a scale ranging from 0 (no fatigue/absent) to 10 (As bad as you can imagine/worst imaginable). The MPN-SAF TSS was computed as the average of the observed items multiplied by 10 to achieve a 0-to-100 scale. The MPN-SAF TSS thus had a possible score range of 0 to 100.

arm_group.description: All patients will receive ruxolitinib at a starting dose of 10 mg twice daily which could be titrated to most appropriate dose. Dose was not to exceed 25 mg bid nor be less than 5 mg once a day

intervention.description: supplied as 5 mg, 10 mg and 20 mg tablets to be taken orally

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
•Confirmed diagnosis of PV according to the 2008 World Health Organization criteria, palpable spleen, Resistant to or intolerant of hydroxyurea, ECOG performance status of 0, 1 or 2; did not have access to a comparable or satisfactory alternative treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
•Inadequate liver or renal function, Significant bacterial, fungal, parasitic, or viral infection requiring treatment, Active malignancy within the past 5 years, except treated cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, basal cell carcinoma of the skin, or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, with no evidence for recurrence in the past 3 years., Women who were pregnant or nursing.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 161 patients were included in the ruxolitinib arm and 100% of the patient’s received the treatment

group.description: All patients will receive ruxolitinib at a starting dose of 10 mg twice daily which could be titrated to most appropriate dose. Dose was not to exceed 25 mg bid nor be less than 5 mg once a day

measure.title: Number of participants resistant or intolerant to hydroxyurea (HU)
measure.description: Definition of resistant or intolerant was based on physician’s evaluation

measure.title: Number of participants' frequency of phlebotomy in 52 weeks prior to screening
Number of participants' use of prior antineoplastic therapy
measure.description: Other prior anti-neoplastic medications included busulfan, interferon, peginterferon, pipobroman, anagrelide, momelotinib, tioguanine, mercapturine and sodium phosphate

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form Total Symptom Score (MPN-SAF TSS)
outcome.description: The MPN-SAF (Appendix 6) was a disease specific questionnaire comprised of 10 items that measures fatigue related to MPN disease and the severity of nine of the most prevalent associated symptoms including: early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain, fever and weight loss. There were three recall periods used in this questionnaire, which were 24 hours for fatigue, the past week for symptoms of early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain and fever, and the past 6 months for weight loss, Each item was scored on a scale ranging from 0 (no fatigue/absent) to 10 (As bad as you can imagine/worst imaginable). The MPN-SAF TSS was computed as the average of the observed items multiplied by 10 to achieve a 0-to-100 scale. The MPN-SAF TSS thus had a possible score range of 0 to 100.
outcome.population: Number of participants qualifying for evaluation of change from baseline varied across visits

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form Total Symptom Score (MPN-SAF TSS)
measure.description: The MPN-SAF (Appendix 6) was a disease specific questionnaire comprised of 10 items that measures fatigue related to MPN disease and the severity of nine of the most prevalent associated symptoms including: early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain, fever and weight loss. There were three recall periods used in this questionnaire, which were 24 hours for fatigue, the past week for symptoms of early satiety, abdominal discomfort, inactivity, concentration, night sweats, itching, bone pain and fever, and the past 6 months for weight loss, Each item was scored on a scale ranging from 0 (no fatigue/absent) to 10 (As bad as you can imagine/worst imaginable). The MPN-SAF TSS was computed as the average of the observed items multiplied by 10 to achieve a 0-to-100 scale. The MPN-SAF TSS thus had a possible score range of 0 to 100.
measure.population: Number of participants qualifying for evaluation of change from baseline varied across visits

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) were collected from First Patient First Visit (FPFV) until Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV). All AEs reported in this record are from date of First Patient First Treatment until Last Patient Last Visit) up to approximately 26 months

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients will receive ruxolitinib at a starting dose of 10 mg twice daily which could be titrated to most appropriate dose. Dose was not to exceed 25 mg bid nor be less than 5 mg once a day

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
